intro: Herpetophytum oxychilum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and clusters of showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is known for its compact growth habit. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Herpetophytum oxychilum is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
